intro: Eremalche rotundifolia, commonly known as the roundleaf eremalche, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its biennial growth habit. The plant features a basal rosette of rounded, hairy leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in umbels. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, and is often found in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
